Ransomware is no longer just a nuisance . Now it 's quite literally a matter of life and death . <S4> A massive ransomware attack being labeled as `` WannaCry '' has been reported around the world </S4> and is responsible for <S5> shutting down hospitals in the United Kingdom and encrypting files at Spanish telecom firm Telefonica </S5> . The WannaCry attack is not a zero-day flaw , but rather is based on an exploit that Microsoft patched with its MS17-010 advisory on March 14 in the SMB Server . However , <S2> Microsoft did not highlight the SMB flaw until April 14 </S2> , when a <S1> hacker group known as the Shadow Brokers released a set of exploits </S1> , allegedly stolen from the U.S.National Security Agency . SMB , or Server Message Block , is a critical protocol used by Windows to enable file and folder sharing . It 's also the protocol that today 's WannaCry attack is exploiting to rapidly spread from one host to the next around the world , literally at the speed of light .

data.annotated_text: 'Cloud Hopper ' campaign by sophisticated APT10 hacking group uses advanced phishing and customised malware to conduct espionage . <S0> A Chinese hacking group with advanced cyber-espionage capabilities has been targeting managed IT services providers across the globe </S0> in a campaign to steal sensitive data . <S1> The cybercriminal gang is using sophisticated phishing attacks and customised malware </S1> in order to <S3> infect victims ' machines and then gain access to IT providers and their customer networks </S3> . Dubbed Operation Cloud Hopper , <S2> the cyber-espionage campaign has been uncovered by security researchers at PwC , BAE Systems , and the UK 's National Cyber Security Centre </S2> . The researchers say the campaign is `` highly likely '' to be the work of the China-based APT10 hacking group . The group has been focusing on espionage since 2009 and has evolved from targeting US defence firms as well as the technology and telecommunications sectors to targeting organisations in multiple industries across the globe . The group was behind the Poison Ivy malware family and has evolved its operations to include using custom tools capable of compromising high volumes of data from organisations and their customers , and stealthily moving it around the world .

data.annotated_text: The email didn � t just seem innocent , it also seemed familiar to the accounts payable employee at MacEwan University in Edmonton . It was from one of the local construction firms the public institution deals with , logo and all . There was new bank account information �could accounts payable please change it ? The staff and this supposed vendor communicated back and forth , from late June until a few weeks ago , in early August . One university employee was involved in this correspondence at first ; two more were added . Then vendor payments went through , as scheduled : $ 1.9 million from MacEwan accounts on August 10 . Last week , the Internal Revenue Service ( IRS ) issued a new warning to employers , urging them to stay alert as reports of compromised W-2 records started to climb . This newest advisory aligns with the agency 's plan to delay refunds for those filing their returns early in order to combat identity theft and fraud . The IRS also informed employers the W-2 scam has moved beyond corporations , expanding to include schools , tribal organizations , and nonprofits . In a statement , IRS Commissioner , John Koskinen , said the scams - sometimes known as Business Email Compromise ( BEC ) attacks - are some of the most dangerous email scams the agency has seen in a long time .
